title: noAriaUnsupportedElements
description: |
  Enforce that elements that do not support ARIA roles, states, and properties do not have those attributes.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

**Diagnostic Category: `lint/a11y/noAriaUnsupportedElements`**
<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JSX and TSX" icon="seti:javascript">
**Since**: `v1.0.0`
:::note
- This rule is recommended by Biome. A diagnostic error will appear when linting your code.
- This rule has an **unsafe** fix.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://github.com/jsx-eslint/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/blob/main/docs/rules/aria-unsupported-elements.md" target="_blank"><code>jsx-a11y/aria-unsupported-elements</code></a>

## Description
Enforce that elements that do not support ARIA roles, states, and properties do not have those attributes.

## Examples

### Invalid

```jsx
<meta charset="UTF-8" role="meta" />
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.jsx:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-aria-unsupported-elements">lint/a11y/noAriaUnsupportedElements</a> <span
```jsx
<html aria-required="true" />
```

### Valid

```jsx
<meta charset="UTF-8" />
```

```jsx
<html></html>
```

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"a11y": {
				"noAriaUnsupportedElements": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
